intro: Gissonia collina, commonly known as the mountain gizzard, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and striking purple-blue flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. Gissonia collina thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
